metadata.titel_preek: Rules of the Freedom Game (Lent III)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a 'playing field' of freedom by giving the Decalogue to a people He has already rescued, transforming Law from a burden into a charter of liberty.

tekstueel_bewijs: revelation of the will of God to reshape us
the way of being and living in the truth
the kind and merciful Father who loved us so much
given into a community of people that had already been chosen
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (The hearer is the beneficiary of the rescue and the rules)

tekstueel_bewijs: gave his only-begotten Son, to save us
incline our hearts to keep this law

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but the 'house of bondage' and the 'bad news of religiosity' which kills the spirit.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian living out the commandments in daily life (the 'game').
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical life is the 'game' played only after God has set the field and rescued the players.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is the one who has given us a place of grace
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have believed in Christ Jesus
I am apparently incapable of shoplifting

voorbeelden: This you must do, or else (rejected tonality)
willing embrace of the Father’s loving commandments
none of us can obey any commandment without that grace

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) granted by Grace. It argues that Law provides the 'Savoir' (Knowledge) of the game, but only Grace provides the 'Pouvoir' to play it freely.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Bondage/Egypt) to S1 (Freedom/Covenant), while warning against the trap of ~S1 (Moralism) and ~S2 (Sentimentality/Lawlessness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by placing the Law inside the Covenant of Grace (The 'A-Team' setting).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Bondage is described as 'Egypt' and 'repression'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly subordinates Law to Gospel and defines obedience as a consequence of being 'already chosen' and 'already rescued.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I am apparently incapable of shoplifting.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God's determination to rescue us and put us on a new playing field.
The Commandments were given into a community of people that had already been chosen.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher uses herself (shoplifting) and Andrew Young (fidelity) as examples of 'freedom.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on God as the one who makes the heart 'incapable' of sin through the gift of a new identity.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and joy; the rules are seen as protective boundaries rather than hurdles.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Excellent integration of the 'Game' metaphor to explain the relationship between Law and Gospel.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'God's rescue' to 'Virginia honor' risks grounding ethics in social identity rather than the Spirit.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Belonging to that Father’s family... life in a free space.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; sin is 'bondage' and 'wandering in the dark'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Primary Subject of the rescue, positioning the Law as a gift (Object) to the Church (Receiver).

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The Virginia family analogy might make the hearer identify with 'social honor' rather than 'divine grace.'
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Identify with the 'helpless Israelite' in Egypt.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Strengthen the 'Rescue' narrative before the 'Honor' narrative.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more focus on the 'Opponent' (the power of sin) to make the 'Pouvoir' of grace more miraculous.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Elaborate on why we *can't* keep the law without the 'incline our hearts' moment.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Sin is mentioned but often as 'mistakes' or 'social consequences' (herpes/AIDS).
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame sin as a 'Power' that only God can break.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To avoid the sermon becoming a 'common sense' argument for morality.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Rescue from Egypt) → Ethics (The Rules of the Game).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses the Law to point to the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Game' metaphor's persuasiveness, Greimas shows how the metaphor functions to reassign the hearer from 'Slave' to 'Player'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Decalogue's history; semiotics explains how the Decalogue functions as a 'modal competence' (Pouvoir) for the believer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Virginia Honor' section actually functions as a 'Secondary Narrative Program' that risks competing with the 'Primary Program' of Divine Grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a strong example of Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' despite the personal anecdotes.
